author: Jonathan Carroll
quote: Just because I'm silent, doesn't mean I have nothing to say.

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote: Better to belong to some than to everyone.

author: Wisława Szymborska
quote: Reading books is the most beautiful pastime humanity has invented.

author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
quote: Books are mirrors: you only see in them what you already have inside you.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
quote: One sees clearly only with the heart. What is essential is invisible to the eye.

author: Michaił Bułhakow
quote: – Is this vodka? – asked Margarita in a weak voice. (...) – For heaven's sake, queen – he croaked – would I dare to pour vodka for a lady? This is pure alcohol.

author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
quote: The moment you start wondering whether you love someone, you've already stopped loving them forever.

author: Alan Alexander Milne
quote: - And if one day I have to leave? - asked Christopher Robin, squeezing Winnie-the-Pooh's paw. - What then? - Nothing much. - reassured Pooh. - I'll just sit here and wait for you. When you love someone, that someone never disappears.

author: Wisława Szymborska
book: Nic dwa razy: Wybór wierszy - Nothing Twice: Selected Poems
quote:
No day repeats itself,
no two nights are alike,
no two kisses are the same,
no two glances into eyes are alike.

author: Paulo Coelho
quote: One loves because one loves. There is no reason for it.

author: Alan Alexander Milne
quote: -Pooh? -Yes, Piglet? -Nothing- said Piglet, taking Pooh's paw - I just wanted to be sure of you.

author: J.K. Rowling
quote: (...) people have a natural talent for choosing precisely what is worst for them.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
quote: Love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.

author: Winston Groom
quote: Life is like a box of chocolates - you never know what you're gonna get.

author: Gilbert Keith Chesterton
quote: A room without books is like a body without a soul.

author: Cassandra Clare
quote: -Haven't you fallen in love with the right person yet? -Unfortunately, I remain my only love. -At least you don't worry about rejection, boy. -Not necessarily. From time to time, I reject myself to make things more interesting.

author: C.S. Lewis
quote: Friendship is born the moment when one person says to another, 'What! You too? I thought I was the only one.'

author: Suzanne Collins
quote: It's ten times harder to pick up than to spill.

author: Umberto Eco
quote: Those who read books live double lives.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
quote: - Is one a little lonely in the desert? - Equally lonely among people.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
quote: Friends are like silent angels who lift us up when our wings forget how to fly.

author: William Wharton
quote: To love someone is above all to allow them to be what they are.

author: Paulo Coelho
quote: What's funniest about people is that they always think backwards: they rush into adulthood and then sigh for lost childhood. They sacrifice health for money, then lose money to recover health. They worry about the future, forgetting about the present, and thus they neither live in the present nor the future. They live as if they will never die, and die as if they had never lived.

author: Jane Austen
quote: The world suffers from a lack of men, especially those who are worth something.

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
quote: You know... when one is very sad, one likes sunsets...

author: Stephen King
quote: Killing for peace is like fucking for virginity.

author: Terry Pratchett
quote: When you break rules, break them hard and for good.

author: Phil Bosmans
quote: The most beautiful moments in life cannot be planned. They come by themselves.

author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
quote: We exist as long as someone remembers us.

author: J.K. Rowling
quote: Do not pity the dead, Harry, pity the living, and above all those who live without love.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: If a cluttered desk is a sign of a cluttered mind, of what, then, is an empty desk a sign?

author: Ken Kesey
quote: Nothing irritates people who want to make your life miserable more than behaving as if you don't notice.

author: Charles Bukowski
quote: I had a bad day. A week. A month. A year. A life. Damn it.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book: Hobbit, czyli tam i z powrotem
quote: He who searches, most often finds something, unfortunately sometimes not what he needs.

author: Cassandra Clare
quote: To love is to destroy, and to be loved is to be destroyed.

author: Nicholas Sparks
quote: True love means caring more about the happiness of the other person than your own, no matter how painful the choices you face.

author: Becca Fitzpatrick
quote: Remember, people change, but their past does not.

author: Cassandra Clare
quote: You must always be careful with books and what is inside them, for words have the power to change people.

author: J.K. Rowling
quote: If someone loves us so much, then even if they leave forever, their love will always protect us.

author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
quote: ...he who truly loves, loves in silence, by action, not by words.

author: Giovanni Giacomo Casanova
quote: Beware of the man who has read only one book.

author: Mark Twain
quote: Every man is like the Moon. He has a side he never shows to anybody.

author: Paulo Coelho
quote: It is the possibility of having a dream come true that makes life interesting.

author: Harlan Coben
quote: It's better to love and then cry. Another nonsense. Believe me, it's not better at all. Don't show me paradise only to burn it down.

author: Éric-Emmanuel Schmitt
quote: ...life is such a strange gift. At first you overestimate it: you think you have eternal life. Then you underestimate it, you think it's a mess, too short, you almost want to reject it. Finally, you realize that it wasn't a gift, but just a loan. And you try to deserve it.

author: Cassandra Clare
quote: I love you. I will love you until the day I die. And if there's a life after that, I will love you then.

author: Janusz Leon Wiśniewski
quote: Words can also touch. Even more tenderly than hands.

author: Cassandra Clare
quote: Sarcasm is the last refuge for the imaginatively bankrupt.

author: Gabriel García Márquez
quote: You will most feel the absence of a person when you sit next to them and know that they will never be yours.

author: J.K. Rowling
quote: There are some events that - experienced together - must end in friendship...

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
quote: You are responsible, forever, for what you have tamed.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: - Sleep is good. - he said. - And books are better.

author: Stephen King
quote: [...] God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change; courage to change the things I can; and wisdom to know the difference. [...]

author: Suzanne Collins
quote:
So when he whispers:
- You love me. True or false?
I answer:
- True.

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote: We know little about love. Love is like a pear. A pear is sweet and has a shape. Try to define the shape of a pear.

author: Terry Pratchett
quote: There is death and taxes, but taxes are worse, because at least death doesn't happen to you every year.

author: Paulo Coelho
quote: Someone is always waiting for someone in the world.

author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
quote: People are willing to believe anything but the truth.

author: Maya Angelou
quote: Life is not measured by the number of breaths we take, but by the moments that take our breath away.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it.

author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
quote: Talking is the act of fools, silence - the act of cowards, and listening - the act of wise men.

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote: It's better to move forward aimlessly than to stand still aimlessly, and certainly far better than to move backward aimlessly.

author: Becca Fitzpatrick
quote:
- You are a psychopath
- I prefer the term "a man with imagination"

author: Cassandra Clare
quote: Do you know what the worst feeling I can imagine is? Not trusting the person you love most in the world.

author: Krystyna Siesicka
quote: A man is a noun, and nouns are governed by cases.

author: George Orwell
quote: The creatures outside looked from pig to man, and from man to pig, and from pig to man again; but already it was impossible to say which was which.

author: J.K. Rowling
quote: Just because you have the emotional range of a teaspoon doesn't mean we all have.

author: Lucy Maud Montgomery
quote: Tomorrow is always fresh, with no mistakes in it yet.

author: Suzanne Collins
quote: Some walks you have to take alone.

author: Albert Einstein
quote: Only two things are infinite, the universe and human stupidity, and I'm not sure about the former.

author: John Green
quote: My thoughts are stars I cannot fathom into constellations.

author: Cassandra Clare
quote: Unfortunately, the one thing that human beings do the most is lie to themselves.

author: Maja Lidia Kossakowska
quote: I won't fall, I won't even fucking stumble.

author: Oscar Wilde
quote: Nowadays people know the price of everything and the value of nothing.

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote: You're nearly forty, you look thirty, you think twenty, and you act as though you're not yet ten.

author: Paulo Coelho
quote: And, when you want something, all the universe conspires in helping you to achieve it.

author: John Green
quote:
"Okay," he said after forever. "Maybe 'okay' will be our 'always'."
"Okay," I said.

author: Éric-Emmanuel Schmitt
book: Oscar and the Lady in Pink
quote: We forget that life is fragile, that it can be taken from us at any moment.

author: Anne Frank
book: The Diary of a Young Girl
quote: Regular people are not aware of how much closed doors mean to someone.

author: Stephenie Meyer
quote: If you could live forever, what would you live for?

author: Mahatma Gandhi
quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.

author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
quote: Destiny usually waits just around the corner. Like a thief, a hooker, or a lottery vendor: its favorite disguises. But what it doesn't do is stand still. You have to chase after it.

author: Cassandra Clare
quote:
"You said you were going for a walk. How does a walk take six hours?"
"Long walk?"

author: Jodi Picoult
quote: Every loner, despite their protests to the contrary, will remain lonely because they tried to become part of the world but couldn't, because they experienced constant disappointments from people.

author: Nicholas Sparks
quote: You have to love something to hate it.

author: John Green
quote: The world is not a wish-granting factory.

author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
quote: "Do you know what's the best thing about a broken heart? (...) It can only really break once. The rest is just scratches."

author: Becca Fitzpatrick
quote:
"I don't date strangers," I said.
"Lucky for me, I do. I'll pick you up at five."

author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
quote: You risk tears if you let yourself be tamed.

author: Jeanette Winterson
quote: The hole in my heart is shaped like you and no one else fits in.

author: Terry Pratchett
quote: People who don't need people need people to show them that they don't need people.

author: J.K. Rowling
book: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
quote: Death is the last enemy to be destroyed.

author: Emily Brontë
quote: He's more myself than I am. Whatever our souls are made of, his and mine are the same. If all else perished, and he remained, I should still continue to exist. And if all else remained, and he were annihilated, the universe would turn to a mighty stranger: I should not seem a part of it.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
quote: Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends.

author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón
quote: To read is to live more intensely.

author: Cassandra Clare
quote: She could close her eyes and pretend that everything was fine, but she knew that you couldn't live with your eyes closed.

author: Erich Maria Remarque
quote: The less you know, the easier it is to live. Knowledge gives freedom, but it also brings unhappiness.

author: Suzanne Collins
quote: You've got as much charm as a dead slug.

author: Bolesław Prus
quote: Spit on everything that has passed: on your own pain and on others' wickedness... Choose any goal, any at all, and start a new life.

author: J.K. Rowling
book: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
quote: Masking your pain for a while only makes it come back stronger.

author: Mikhail Bulgakov
quote: It's unclear why everyone addresses cats as 'you', though no cat has ever shared a drink with anyone.

author: Suzanne Collins
quote: I can't believe how normal I look on the outside, when inside I feel like I've been in a war.

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote:
"On my seahill," growled Zoltan, drawing his sword, "ancient dwarven runes are inscribed with an ancient dwarven spell. Let any ghoul come within sword's length and remember me. Oh, look here."
"Ha," Jaskier was intrigued, approaching them. "So these are the famous secret dwarven runes? What does the inscription say?"
"To hell with bastards!"

author: Cornelia Funke
quote: Have you noticed that a book becomes much thicker after several readings? [...] As if something stays between the pages: feelings, thoughts, sounds, smells... And when after years I start flipping through it, we find ourselves younger, different... A book preserves us like a dried flower; we find ourselves and yet not ourselves.

author: Stephenie Meyer
quote: Death is easy, simple; life is harder.

author: Cassandra Clare
quote:
"What are you doing?" Alec asked, kneeling by the flickering prison wall.
(...)
"Oh, just thought I'd lie down on the floor and roll around in agony," he snapped. "It's relaxing."
"Really? And... are you being sarcastic?"

author: Winston Groom
quote: When you think it can't get any worse, start hitting your foot with a board. You'll see how relieved you feel when you stop.

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote: Quiet, quiet children. It's not demons, not devils... Worse. It's people.

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote: Beware of disappointments, for appearances deceive. Things are rarely as they seem. And women, never.

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
book: The Last Wish / Sword of Destiny
quote: "Yes, yes," Jaskier sighed again. "The world changes, the sun sets, and the vodka runs out."

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote: It's good to feel fear. Feeling fear means there's something to fear. So be vigilant. Fear doesn't need to be overcome. Just don't give in to it. And it's worth learning from it.

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote: Flight number seven: bell with a handle, brass, made by dwarf work, age of the find difficult to estimate, but it is certainly ancient. Inscribed on the perimeter in dwarven runes, it reads: "And what the fuck are you ringing for?" Starting price...

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote: "I used to dabble in debauchery and invest in brothels. I mingled among politicians and met many. And I learned that it's better to quit with whores, because whores at least have some honor and some rules."

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote:
"Sauerkraut! (...) A tasty and salutary thing, sauerkraut. In winter, when vitamins are lacking, it protects against scurvy. It is also an excellent antidepressant."
"How so?"
"You eat a pot of sauerkraut, wash it down with a pot of curdled milk... and soon depression becomes the least of your worries."

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote: The tale continues, history never ends.

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote: Once they locked a goat in the shed with a cabbage head. In the morning, no trace of cabbage, and the goat shat green. But there's no evidence and no witnesses, so the case is closed, causa finita.

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote:
[Caldemeyn] - But, between us, don't do what you did last time during dinner. 
[Geralt] - You mean throwing a fork at the rat?
[Caldemeyn] - No. I mean hitting it, although it was dark.

author: Andrzej Sapkowski
quote:
- You, gray-haired rascal, still bad at counting - Fryga hissed. - Do we need to help you count again? There are three of us. Means, there are more of us.
- There are three of you - he glanced at them - and I am one. But that doesn't mean there are more of you. It's a mathematical paradox and an exception to the rule.
- So what does it mean?
- It means, get the hell out of here while you still can jump around. Before you lose the ability to jump.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: You know nothing, Jon Snow.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: When the sun sets, a candle won't replace it.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote:
And who are you, proud lord,
that I must bow so low?
Only a cat of a different coat,
that's all the truth I know.
In a coat of gold or a coat of red,
lion still has claws.
And mine are long and sharp, my lord,
as long and sharp as yours.
So he spoke, Lord Castamere,
bold and grand,
But now the rains weep o'er his hall,
with no one there to hear.
Yes, now the rains weep o'er his hall,
and not a soul to hear.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: Sometimes I think everyone is pretending to be brave, when they're really not. Maybe it's pretending that makes us brave. I don't know.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: There was a high probability that unlucky Willas Tyrell would suffer a sudden, deadly sword accident in the stomach, which would rather harm the alliance between Highgarden and Casterly Rock.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: All this begins in the past - Tyrion thought. - From our mothers and fathers, and from their parents before them. We are marionettes dancing on the strings of those who lived before us, and one day our children will take over these strings after us and dance instead of us.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote:
- What else can I do if not die?
- Live.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: I am offended only by lies, never by sincere advice.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote:
Arya crossed her arms on her chest.
- Valar morghulis - she said loudly, as if she knew what it meant.
- Valar dohaeris - he replied, touching his forehead with two fingers.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: As long as enemies are in the field, victory is out of the question.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: Every action can be a prayer, if we perform it as well as we can.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: If a man doesn't use his member, it will keep shrinking until one day he wants to pee and can't find it.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: Even brave men often prefer to be blind when they are afraid to see something.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: Sadgekins may fuck himself with a hot poker up his arse.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: Give me sweet lies and take away your bitter truths.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: - She can't speak - said the man in the yellow cloak. - You slit her throat too deep, you fucking bastards. But she remembers.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: One king means peace.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: (...) but he thought that for the dead, fear doesn't matter, just like pain, love, or duty.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: The gods created the earth for all people. However, when kings arrived with their crowns and steel swords, they announced that it all belonged to them. They said: 'These are my trees. You cannot eat these apples. This is my stream. You cannot fish in it. This is my forest. You cannot hunt in it. My land, my water, my castle, my daughter, keep your hands off them, or I'll cut them off for you. But if you kneel before me, maybe I'll let you sniff a little.' You call us thieves, but a thief must be brave, clever, and quick. A kneeler just has to kneel.

author: George R.R. Martin
quote: - You are mine - she whispered. - Mine, and I am yours. If we die, so be it. Everyone must die, Jon Snow. But first, we live.
